headline: AT&T-Echostar Deal Good For The Long Term, But Probably Delays Dividend Raise
summary: AT&T Inc.'s spectrum deal with EchoStar Corporation boosts broadband expansion and competitiveness, offsetting delayed dividends. Click for my T update.

headline: EchoStar: AT&T Deal Pays Well, But Is Only Half The Story
summary: EchoStar Corporation's $22.65B spectrum sale to AT&T Inc. shifts industry dynamics, benefiting Verizon & T-Mobile. Click for more on SATS and T.

raw.headline: EchoStar: AT&T Deal Pays Well, But Is Only Half The Story
raw.summary: EchoStar Corporation's $22.65B spectrum sale to AT&T Inc. shifts industry dynamics, benefiting Verizon & T-Mobile. Click for more on SATS and T.

headline: AT&T Expands 5G Empire With $23 Billion EchoStar Spectrum Acquisition
summary: EchoStar Corp. (NASDAQ:SATS) shares climbed on Tuesday after AT&T Inc. (NYSE:T) revealed plans to purchase spectrum licenses worth $23 billion in an all-cash transaction. The move aims to bolster AT&T’s wireless and fiber network capacity while positioning the company as a long-term leader in advanced connectivity across the U.S. The acquisition will deliver roughly 50 MHz of low-band and mid-band spectrum nationwide, covering more than 400 markets. Also Read: Rocket Lab (RKLB) Stock Soars: What

headline: EchoStar Surges On $23 Billion AT&T Spectrum Purchase. FCC Approval Needed.
summary: EchoStar stock surged and AT&T stock rose after AT&T said it will buy midband spectrum licenses from EchoStar for $23 billion.

raw.headline: EchoStar Surges On $23 Billion AT&T Spectrum Purchase. FCC Approval Needed.

headline: From Main Street to Low Earth Orbit: How T-Mobile Keeps People Connected During Disasters
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., August 26, 2025--As National Preparedness Month arrives this September, T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) has expanded technology and resources to support connectivity when communities face natural disasters and severe storms — expanding its drone fleet, launching T-Satellite with Starlink, adding more deployable assets and vehicles and further hardening the network.
